data.title: Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actor
authors: Contributors to Ultimate Soap Fan Wiki
data.meta_description: This category was introduced in 1985. The title of the award has changed over the years previously the category was called Outstanding Young Man, Outstanding Juvenile Male and Outstanding Younger Leading Actor. The category has an age requirement which has varied in different years. The current...
data.text:
This category was introduced in 1985. The title of the award has changed over the years previously the category was called Outstanding Young Man, Outstanding Juvenile Male and Outstanding Younger Leading Actor. The category has an age requirement which has varied in different years. The current age requirement is that a nominee must be under the age of 25 in the episode they are submitting. In 2020, younger actor and younger actress were combined into one category.

Winners and Nominees[]

Winners are noted in bold:

1985

Brian Bloom (Dusty Donovan, As the World Turns)

Stephen Caffrey (Andrew Cortlandt, All My Children)

Michael E. Knight (Tad Martin, All My Children)

Michael O'Leary (Rick Bauer, Guiding Light)

Jack Wagner (Frisco Jones, General Hospital)

Breakdown[]

By Series

All My Children - 16 Nominations / 2 Wins

Another World - 1 Nomination / 0 Wins

As the World Turns - 20 Nominations / 2 Wins

The Bold and the Beautiful - 9 Nominations / 4 Wins

Days of our Lives - 22 Nominations / 7 Wins

General Hospital - 31 Nominations / 7 Wins

Generations - 1 Nomination / 0 Wins

Guiding Light - 22 Nominations / 7 Wins

One Life to Live - 4 Nominations / 1 Win

Passions - 2 Nominations / 0 Wins

Port Charles - 2 Nominations / 0 Wins

Ryan's Hope - 1 Nomination / 0 Wins

Santa Barbara - 3 Nominations / 1 Win

Sunset Beach - 1 Nomination / 0 Wins

The Young and the Restless - 33 Nominations / 4 Wins

By Actor (more than 5 nominations)

Jonathan Jackson - 6

Bryan Buffington - 5

Scott Clifton - 5

Bryton James - 5

Andy Kavovit - 5

David Lago - 5

Joshua Morrow - 5

Most Wins (multiple)

Jonathan Jackson - 3

Chandler Massey - 3

Bryan Craig - 2

Tom Pelphrey - 2

Michael E. Knight - 2

Kevin Mambo - 2

Justin Gocke is the youngest winner at 11 in 1989 and Michael E. Knight is the oldest at 28 in 1987.
